channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Brown settee littered on Harrier Mews Thamesmead pavement., 6th January
item.description:
As you come into Harrier Mews SE28 0DQ from Goldfinch Road, as you drive into the road, look to your right on the pavement, you will see a pile of dark brown sofa set placed on the pavement. This blights the road and saddens and depresses me a lot to see all these household waste being dumped under the cover of night by local residents. The fact that they do it at night to conceal their identity is clear evidence that these people know it is a crime to fly tip. Please can you investigate the two cases reported tonight and have the nuisance items dumped on our pavements removed. Thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Merganser Gardens, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive amounts of domestic waste dumped outside 19 Wrottesley Road, 6th January
item.description:
Looks like someone from the HMO on 19 Wrottesley Road has left a huge amount of domestic tat on the public pavement. Photo taken 6th January 2026 when this first appeared.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wrottesley Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household items left on the pedestrian pavement in front of number 35 Harrier Mews Thamesmead London SE28 0DQ, 6th January
item.description:
The lady living at number 35 Harrier Mews Thamesmead London SE28 0DQ brought the items pictured in the photo attached out of her house on 30/12/2025 and placed them on the public pavement. This not only blights the street, it also prevents wheelchair and pushchairs from free access to the pavement. This lady frequently fly tips items onto the pavement knowing that these household waste will not be collected by the refuse team. This behaviour can’t continue, we are constantly trying to keep up with all these people causing a nuisance by tipping their rubbish everywhere without consideration for the rest of us. It’s just not fair. This lady has an estate car but instead of going to the recycling centre like the rest of us, she chooses to litter the street with her waste. Please kindly address this problem as soon as possible. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harrier Mews, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped tumble dryer and other household items, 6th January
item.description:
It’s blocking the pathway and the bins to the flats. They have been put against the bins of 26 Hazel walk of people it doesn’t belong to. Making it difficult for us to access and use our own bin sheds.

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 Lairdale Estate – southern vehicle, 6th January
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 Lairdale Estate – southern vehicle entrance ie Lairdale Close – green box tagged – box would seem to be control box for the new Lambeth car chargers which are out of view on the left hand side. . Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin, picture and Google Streetview link (which does not show box as so new): https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4452464,-0.0983916,3a,48.9y,310.12h,85.45t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sUqJN2JyYFGJwnbUzOUb4Ew!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D4.550033147754704%26panoid%3DUqJN2JyYFGJwnbUzOUb4Ew%26yaw%3D310.1199527727562!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTIwOS4wIKXMDSoKLDEwMDc5MjA2N0gBUAM%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosendale Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 51.547469,-0.186806 .. https://w3w.co/spun.undulation.mobile, 6th January
item.description:
There is an electrical cabinet that's open looked damaged door. has consumer unit/sockets /traffic light controls wired that are live at 230v (there was blinking lights on so I know it's live ) I'm disabled. I was not able to secure it. I did put some insulation tape round it and ties the ends together. (To wet and cold for the tape to stick So used as rope) So the door is not swinging open. I don't know if this is council or private land. Could you please send someone out to screw it shut ASAP. I'm worried a kid will get a shock I did best I could
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag on lamp post just below the light, 6th January
item.description:
This is the second flag to go up on this post and this time it’s right underneath the light. This causes a problem because the light flickers into my bedroom making a light show. Sometimes it triggers my cctv camera to go off as well because of the gigantic shadow it produces. I did report this last year but nothing has been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frinsted Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Abbot's Place, South Hampstead, Greater London

item.title: Lamp post 6 and s5 at the intersection of Kingsley Road with Priory Park Road, 6th January
item.description:
The light marked as s5 where Kingsley Road intersects Priory Park Road has not been lit since the end of November. Given that also the adjacent lamp post at the bottom of Kingsley road marked as 6 is not lit that corner of the road is completely dark after sundown. This situation has instigated more fly-tipping.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leak onto pathway, 6th January
item.description:
This sewerage leak has been ongoing for over a year. It’s dangerous, smells really bad and goes right across the path at the bottom. No one should have to walk through this. It is now icing over because of the cold weather. There doesn’t seem to have been any attempt to rectify the problem. Can this be investigated and resolved please. Animals could walk through this as well and get ill.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Freezer left abandoned, 6th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): New North Road, Hackney, London
